After examining the lack of attention toward animal abuse, it is contended that those who study and work with families must urgently address animal abuse for seven critical reasons: (a) animal abuse is an alarming antisocial behavior by children and adolescents; (b) it is disturbingly common in childhood; (c) it poses severe negative developmental consequences; (d) violence toward animals is intrinsically linked to dangerous interpersonal violence; (e) it indicates underlying family violence; (f) the wellbeing of companion animals is being grossly neglected; and (g) failure to address it exacerbates societal violence.
